intro: Lophiolepis turkestanica subsp. pseudolappacea, commonly known as the Turkestan lichen-leaf grass, is a perennial grass species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with spikelets that are typically pale green to brown in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky or sandy soils. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its ecological adaptations and potential role in stabilizing soil in dry regions.
